newsitem.title: USA: House passes $92 billion spending for agencies.
newsitem.headline: House passes $92 billion spending for agencies.

text.p: The House of Representatives Wednesday passed a $91.7 billion spending bill for next year's programmes for veterans, housing, environmental protection, science and space.
The bill, which passed 397-31, will draw White House ire because it slashes the AmeriCorps programme for volunteer community service, one of President Clinton's prized programmes.

The White House said it would object if the bill that funds 17 agencies emerged from Congress without the $400 million AmeriCorps programme largely intact. Lawmakers were expected to restore the funds when the House and Senate mesh their bills.
Nearly half the bill's spending -- $40.4 billion -- goes to Veterans Department programmes for health, education, housing and benefits.
The bill also would provide $25.1 billion for the Department of Housing and Urban Development and $7.2 billion for the Environmental Protection Agency.
Democrats, charging that the bill slighted spending on veterans and the homeless, failed on a ccessfully tried to send the bill back to a House committee to have the spending increased.
